topic.title: Hiding post from user but not muting/blacklisting users
topic.body: Hello guys. Someone knows, how can I hide&delete a certain user posts (but not blacklisting user) if I am not a site owner?

topic.title: ZeroNet over I2P
topic.body: Hello guys, is it possible to make zeronet over I2P-network?

topic.title: Catalog of tracker list in zeronet network
topic.body: Hi guys. Are there any zites inside zeronet network with trackers list like [spammer blocklist](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CufK1ZtvekbFXEpSyKT2gDjf9jnqW8KwG/)?

1548974921_18S47ArorYtHtcicjdGi6VZdhgJgw.body: So, it's sounds great but what about moderation in hubs? Do it has a simple GUI like in original (a.k.a. vanilla) Millchan? Or you can change/delete posts and ban users only by editing in __/data/users/content.json__?

> [pexo](#comment_62_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC): As things are right now, you can only moderate by editing the content.json. GUI moderation is probably coming at some point in the future.

Okay, got it. But how can I delete only one or several posts and don't touching an entire posts there?

1550498248_1Axcs3zkrrpHhBAAZMUhXEQZ4z6ah.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_536_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): If the account is a ZeroID, then ZeroID.bit is the answer.
How?

> [styromaniac](#comment_537_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/

yeah, I know this web-site. But how can I do that in that site.

> [leftside](#comment_627_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): U try to put the username to hide&delete in the text box in that site. Then the block or hide button will appear.

But it will mute **all** user posts.

> [styromaniac](#comment_542_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Note: Muted user file deletion isn't a thing yet. If you see a photo you don't like, then manually delete before you mute.
So as I understand correctly, even If I mute a user, I will still seed his all files?

1550688425_1Axcs3zkrrpHhBAAZMUhXEQZ4z6ah.body:
> [nekololi](#comment_338_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): it might be possible currently with modification to zeronet's code, and the end result might be that you will only be able to peer with other i2p network nodes. [...]
It's strange because I2P is much better for P2P-hosting than Tor network.

> [kaffie](#comment_791_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh):  Can you explain what benefits there are to adding i2p?
As far as I know, i2p has a **true decentralization** in opposite to Tor, which in fact is only partly has an decentralization.

> [kaffie](#comment_794_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Yeah it just sounds like a variant of Tor albeit with improvements or something. Not exactly as a replacement for ZeroNet or cjdns/yggdrasil.
But I think it can be replacement for Tor.

1566642594_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [gitcenter](#comment_943_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Ok, a new plugin version is released. Please update. The bugs should be fixed.
As I understand, you need the last version of Zeronet for this. Can you explain me step-by-step, how can I update to the last version. I tried to do this by clicking a three dots in home page. But it said that I am on the last version of Zeronet. So, how can update my ZN client manually?

> [gitcenter](#comment_946_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What is the current version that you are using?
0.6.5 rev3870
